articles.author: Ray Tobler, Shane T Grey, Yassine Souilmi
articles.title: Ancient humans may have paused in Arabia for 30,000 years on their way out of Africa - The Conversation
articles.description: Genetic evidence reveals a long, previously unknown period of adaptation to cold climates in the history of ancient human migrations across the globe.
articles.content: Most scientists agree modern humans developed in Africa, more than 200,000 years ago, and that a great human diaspora across much of the rest of the world occurred between perhaps 60,000 and 50,000 y… [+5029 chars]
